summary: The concept of 'time' encompasses its traditional definition as a chronological dimension as well as its roles in the evolution of ecosystems and organizational structures. With advancements in technology and the Internet, time is no longer a limiting factor but an element that enables decentralized and dynamic systems to flourish. This evolved understanding helps in shaping new models that support less hierarchical and more organic communities.
excerpt: Explores the evolution of the term ecosystem from its biological roots to its expanded meaning in human organizations, advocating for Ecosystem Architecture to foster decentralized communities.
